general.description:
I'm a Senior Executive Financial Planner with over 17 years of wealth management experience. 

I am focused on helping both individuals and businesses achieve their full financial potential by providing them with effective strategies to create wealth, financial security, and ensure optimum personal and financial outcomes.

My personal philosophy is to maintain my values at all times, even when challenged, and to remain focused on delivering only the best possible outcomes for my clients. 

I believe that success is not defined purely by the financial outcomes but by valued processes and a financial ‘journey’ that stands the test of time.

Specialties:Financial planning, Funds management, Investment strategy, Account management, Superannuation, Financial strategy, Business improvement, Operational development.

jobs.description:
Modoras Financial Performance Group is a privately owned market leader, which was established in 1984. It provides clients with uniquely holistic advice, and life-long financial strategies, supported by exceptional customer care, and highly qualified planners with significant industry experience within the areas of: superannuation, insurance, portfolio construction, estate planning, risk management, pre and post-retirement planning, SMSFs, and wealth management. Its goal is to provide outstanding ‘Above the Line’ performance. The Brisbane team has approximately 20 employees.

In this role, as part of the Senior Management Team, my responsibilities include:

- Completing senior planning work for the Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne offices
- Working closely with clients’ legal, accounting and business advisory teams
- Member of the Senior Management team
- Contributing to Senior Management meetings, including: reviewing targets, proposing and discussing new business ideas, monitoring progress

- Visiting clients

- Provision of superior client service and care, generating quality referrals
- Supervising and direct reporting of three client services officers working across clients for Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne in line with structured key performance indicators
- Briefing planning assistants, planning workflow and implementing appropriate strategies
- Advising the administrative team with respect to high-end solutions 
- Following up on any unpaid fees and larger transactions
- Peer reviewing financial planners advice

Financial Line was part of the same organisation/dealer group as Modoras Financial Performance Group.  

In this role, reporting to the Managing Director, my responsibilities included:
- Planning and strategy work for the Managing Director, prior to him meeting with clients
- Conducting client meetings, following a set sales process
- Relationship building
- Liaising with clients’ legal, accounting and business advisory teams
- Filling Senior Planners’ diaries
- Assisting with marketing activities, e.g. preparing for the regular topical workshops, and successfully liaising with attendees to encourage them to attend
- Managing my time efficiently and effectively
- Working successfully within a cohesive team

general.headline: Host & Senior Correspondent - Sunday Night on 7 at Seven Network
general.description:
Melissa is the Host of the Seven Network’s flagship current affairs program, Sunday Night. She is also an award-winning Journalist and Senior News Presenter with Seven News (Australia). 

She also hosts weekend breakfast on the Smooth FM (NOVA Entertainment) radio network & won the 2014 ACRA for Best Newcomer. 

She anchored the national 4PM news service on the Seven Network for two years and was a Senior News Correspondent and contributor to the Sunday Night program during that time.

In 2014, she released a best selling memoir called Alphabet Soup. 

From 1997-99 and 2002 to 2013, Melissa hosted Australia’s number one breakfast show, Sunrise. She graduated from Charles Sturt University with a Degree in Broadcast Journalism and began her career as a television news reporter in Canberra, joining the Seven Network in 1995. She has covered major news stories around the world.

Melissa has interviewed some of the world’s most famous faces, from Jane Fonda, Katy Perry and Stevie Nicks to Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden, Jerry Lewis and Justin Bieber.
As one of televisions most charismatic and popular partnerships, Mel and Kochie (David Koch) have hosted landmark televisions specials such as TV Turns 50, Reach out to Asia Tsunami Appeal and Where Are They Now?

A multiple Silver Logie nominee as Most Popular Television Presenter, Melissa was voted one of the “most real celebrity mums” and regularly polls in the Top 50 of Reader’s Digests annual list of Most Trusted Australians.

Mel is devoted to her many charities. She is the National Patron for Make A Wish and an ambassador for Westmead Children’s Hospital, World Vision, Children’s Cancer Institute and the National Breast Cancer Foundation.

Melissa is also an ambassador for the Federal Government’s National Road Safety Council and is the Number One Ticket Holder for the GWS Giants (AFL) and Whittlesea Eagles (Vic AFL).
Melissa co-authored the Working Mothers Survival Guide in 2007.

Wesley Noffs entered the field in 1986 as manager of Life Education Australia, in 1987 his father Ted Noffs suffered a massive stroke which forced Wesley into the leadership role of that organisation. 

By 1990 it was evident that Youth Treatment was an under resourced area of Ted Noffs work. Wesley and Amanda felt compelled to bring their skills to this frontier of hope.

Wesley has had a long term commitment to evidence based, accountable and accessible services for young people. Wesley has guided Ted Noffs through changes which have impacted on the AOD, youth and related fields as a whole, providing an ever improving benchmark for good practice and accountability.
 
Ted Noffs now work collaboratively across Australia to provide outreach evidence based, specialised care to rural, urban, indigenous and culturally and linguistically diverse youth and their families. Particularly in NSW, ACT and QLD.

Wesley and his wife Amanda have committed Ted Noffs to accreditation processes, external evaluations, and collaborative project development, while providing vital infrastructure to Ted Noffs, and other organisations, through specialised training from our internal training arm at Ted Noffs. 

Wesley decided to establish the Ted Noffs Awards in 1999 to honour outstanding individual and organisational contributions in the AOD field. 

In 2003, the inaugural National Drug and Alcohol Awards were introduced, as a progression from the Ted Noffs Awards, as a collaboration between Ted Noffs, the Alcohol and other Drugs Council of Australia (ADCA), the Australian Drug Foundation (ADF) and the Australian National Council on Drugs (ANCD). 

Through strong determination to provide current, evidence based and continually evaluated services to young people and their families, We are proud of our status as a leading not for profit organisation supporting youth at risk in priority communities in Australia, continuing and strengthening the legacy of his father Rev. Ted Noffs.

jobs.companyName: NCPIC - National Cannabis Prevention and Information Centre
jobs.description:
The National Cannabis Prevention and Information Centre (NCPIC) was established by the Australian Government in response to community concerns about cannabis use.

In 2007, cannabis was the most commonly used illicit drug in Australia - one in three (33.5%, 5.8 million) Australians aged 14 years and older had used it in their lifetime. Of the same Australians, almost one in ten (9.1%, 1.6 million) had used it in the last year.

Australians aged 20-29 years were the most likely to have used cannabis in the previous 12 months - one in five (20.8%, 0.6 million) had done so. One quarter (25.7%, 0.4 million) of males in this group had used the drug in the previous 12 months.

There are a range of health and social harms associated with cannabis use. In recent times there has also been a marked increase in presentations to specialist alcohol and other drug treatment services for problems associated with use of the drug. According to the National Minimum Data Set of clients of specialised alcohol and other drug treatment services (2005-2006), alcohol is the most common principal drug of concern reported in closed treatment episodes (39%), with cannabis being the most commonly reported illicit drug (25% of cases).

The NCPIC mission is to reduce the use of cannabis in Australia by preventing uptake and providing the community with evidence-based information and interventions.

jobs.companyName: Network of Alcohol and other Drug Agencies
jobs.description:
The Network of Alcohol and Drug Agencies (NADA) is the peak organisation for the non government drug and alcohol sector in NSW. 
Our goal is to support non government drug and alcohol agencies in NSW to reduce the alcohol and drug related harm to individuals, families and the community.
NADA is governed by a Board of Directors elected from the NADA membership.
NADA's membership comprises approximately 90 agencies ranging from health promotion, early intervention, treatment and after-care programs. These agencies are diverse in their approach to service delivery and structure and make up approximately one third of the drug and alcohol sector in NSW. We also have a small membership base in the ACT.

jobs.companyName: Department of Justice and Attorney General
jobs.description:
To advise the Minister on future policy, programs, practices and management directions of juvenile justice in NSW within available resources and with particular reference to vulnerable groups of young people including Indigenous youth, young women and culturally diverse groups.
To advise the Minister on strategies for dealing effectively with offending young persons taking into account relevant research and reports, to make recommendations to the Minister on juvenile justice practices and to commission sound research.
To advise the Minister on issues relating to the preservation of the rights of young people in the NSW juvenile justice system in accordance with the United Nations conventions.
To provide advice and recommendations to the Minister to ensure that the department formulates and implements a long term strategic plan for juvenile justice in accordance with Government policy.
To advise the Minister on strategies to ensure the involvement and co-ordination of other relevant key government and non-government organisations in the provisions of a continuum of services for young people in the juvenile justice system.
To recommend methods for improved co-ordination across Government and community agencies which take into account the legal, educational, rehabilitative, housing, health and family needs of offending young people.
To make recommendations to the Government on appropriate reform to laws, policies and programs relating to juvenile justice.
To consult with, and promote awareness and informed discussion among young people, their families, community groups, the media, the general public and Government on issues connected with juvenile justice.
To provide advice to the Minister on the monitoring and evaluation of the juvenile justice system.
To present an annual report to the Minister on the activities, achievements and concerns of the Juvenile Justice Advisory Council.
To include such other activities as determined by the Minister.

jobs.companyName: The Children (Prevention and Parental Responsibility) Act. 1997
jobs.description:
Guiding principles for courts

(1) In considering how a child should be dealt with under this Part, a court is to have regard to whether the taking of the action under consideration is in the best interests of the child.
(2) Without limiting the matters that the court may take into account for the purposes of subsection (1), the court is to consider:
(a) the nature of the relationship of the child with the child’s parent or parents, and
(b) the attitude to the child, and to the responsibilities of parenthood, demonstrated by the child’s parent or parents, and
(c) the welfare, status and circumstances of the child and of the child’s parent or parents.

The NSW Drug Offensive Council was established in 1982 to provide advice to the Minister of Health on Drug and Alcohol matters. Principally from a intersectorial perspective. Membership typically was made up of Police, Health professionals, Research, Medical, Non Government services and expert individuals from private practice.

The Council was abolished in 1999 as an outcome of the NSW Drug Summit.

Other Chairs were Sir William Refshauge, Prof. Peter Baume and Dr. Richard Walsh.

In 1964 Reverend Ted Noffs began working at the Kings Cross Methodist Church Parish Mission, in Sydney. Ted encountered his first overdose victim and was shocked at the lack of services and expertise in drug and alcohol treatment. Within the first months he renamed it "The Wayside Chapel". Ted helped addicts in his crisis centre, which became famous worldwide. After many years dealing with addicted people he realised equal emphasis needed to be put into prevention, through education. The seeds of Life Education were then born.
 
In 1974 “The Life Education Centre” (LEC) was set up by Rev. Ted Noffs and his wife Margaret, after seeing first-hand the enormous potential and demand for reduction and preventative strategies. In his decision making Ted always asked himself: “Will this build a better world for the children?”

jobs.companyName: National Association for the Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect (NAPCAN)
jobs.description:
The mission of NAPCAN (National Association for Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect) is to advocate on behalf of children and young people and to promote positive change in attitudes, behaviour, policies, practices and the law to prevent abuse and neglect and ensure the safety and wellbeing of all Australian children

In the last year, more than 30,000 individual Australian children were found to have been abused or neglected. A tragic number of children died, thousands of children were seriously injured and tens of thousands of children were physically, psychologically and emotionally damaged.

Child abuse occurs right across Australian society and the long-term, personal, social and economic costs of child abuse and neglect are immense.

NAPCAN believes that it is time to draw the line in the sand and break this cycle of abuse.

NAPCAN works with researchers, professionals, government, business, the media and committed individuals to bring about this change.

The Centre for Volunteering is the peak body in NSW promoting and supporting volunteering and community participation.

The Centre for Volunteering includes Volunteering NSW - our service-delivery arm, and the School of Volunteer Management, a registered training organisation.

We connect people and organisations in order to enrich our community. We achieve this through referral, training, resource development, information and education services to help people get involved in their communities, and enhance the capacity and skills of not-for-profit organisations, corporations and government to become involved in the community.

general.description:
Joe is an experienced CEO & NED, a leadership practitioner focused on delivering transformational change & outcomes that really matter. He looks forward to working with honest, talented people.

Currently Chairman, Findex Group's Client Advisory Group; Chairman, Steven Walter Children's Cancer Foundation;  Board Trustee, Follow Your Dream Foundation & Chairman, Lions Kids Cancer Genome Project.

Dr Collins' career features leadership roles in government, commercial, education & NFP sectors. His career embraces health, financial services, higher education, biotechnology, medical research, commercialising technology, corporatisation & privatisation of State owned enterprises, wagering, gaming & sports betting, philanthropy & volunteering.

Formerly, CEO, St Luke’s Private Hospital & Aged Care Group; Director Operations, Allity Aged Care;  Executive Director, Advancement & Alumni, Western Sydney University & NED, UWS Hawkesbury Foundation; Founding Chairman, Australian Lions Childhood Cancer Research Foundation; Executive Chairman, Immune Systems Therapeutics & Executive Chairman, Children’s Cancer Institute where he led a strategy to become one of Australia’s premier independent MRI's, including construction of a world class $100 million research facility. Formerly, Executive Strategy Adviser, Wagering & Gaming to the MD, PBL & while CEO of TAB's 2 gaming businesses, led their launch across over 3,000 sites. NSW Treasury’s Project Director for the privatisation & $1Billion sale / IPO of NSW TAB.  In mid 1998 he was appointed Head, NSW Electricity Asset Sales Taskforce assisting the government prepare $30B assets sale.

Joe's interests include higher education & health sectors, childhood cancer research & leadership development. Dr Collins is an Honorary Life Fellow, Australian Graduate School of Leadership. In 2007 he was awarded Stanford Australia Association's inaugural NFP leaders scholarship to the Stanford Graduate School of Business in Palo Alto, California.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer
general.description:
Paul Power has been Chief Executive Officer of the Refugee Council of Australia (RCOA), the national peak body for 200 agencies working with refugees and asylum seekers, since 2006.  Paul leads the organisation’s policy development and public education on refugee issues and its advocacy with the Australian Government, international networks and the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees.  Since 2012, Paul has served as a Steering Committee member of the Asia Pacific Refugee Rights Network. Paul has served as a member of the Australian Government’s Refugee Resettlement Advisory Council (2008-14) and as co-chair of the global Working Group on Resettlement and the Annual Tripartite Consultations on Resettlement (2011-12)
Prior to joining RCOA, Paul worked in the NGO sector as a media officer, trainer, researcher and manager, after a 12-year career in the newspaper industry as a journalist and editor.  Through his NGO work, Paul has been involved with projects in international aid, community development, mental health support, volunteer training, social research and advocacy.

general.headline: Board of Directors at World Federation for Mental Health (WFMH) 2017-2019  & Vice President Oceania  Region
general.school: Mount Lofty State High Toowoomba Queensland Australia
general.description:
Michael Burge has been advocating for consumers and carers in mental health for approx. 22 years. Michael has represented consumers and carers on numerous local, state and national committees and written many articles for Mental Health Magazines. 

Michael has conducted over 97 Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) courses throughout rural and remote Australia.  Michael teaches the MHFA course in order to help reduce stigma, to enable people to easily recognise mental health disorders, and to better access help and information. 

On 12 July 2008 Hon. Nicola Roxon MP announced that Michael was selected to be a member of the newly formed Federal Government’s National Advisory Council on Mental Health (NACMH) for a period of 3 years.

Michael is a former Consumer Co-Chair of the National Mental Health Consumer & Carer Forum (NMHCCF) and member 2006 – 2017, Co-Chair for 2 years.

Major highlight was providing a keynote address on Consumer and Participation in mental health systems change at the International Mental Health Leadership (IIMHL) Conference in Ottawa, Canada 2007.  Michael has also recently participated in the IIMHL exchange to Ireland in May 2010 & International Clubhouse Training at Fountain House in New York December 2010.

Another highlight was Co-Chair for the development of the National Certificate IV Mental Health Peer Support Work Learning & Assessment Resources. The project is a watershed project and feedback from a national reference group meeting suggested it is one of the most exciting and ground breaking advancements for peer work in Australia for decades. 

Michael graduated from the Australian Mental Health Commissions Future Leaders in Mental Health Project in February 2015.

In New Delhi India November 2017 appointed as Vice President of the Oceania Region and Board of Directors to the World Federation for Mental Health

jobs.description:
Jade Dixon is a Partner in Outsourced CFO* at PwC. 

Outsourced CFO* provides businesses with access to an all-encompassing finance
function. Jade leads a team of experienced professionals with skills across all levels and
aspects of finance.  We can be your finance team, we can supplement your existing
team or we can work with you to build and support a finance team for your business.  Every business we service has access to their own dedicated CFO.

high-growth, looking to overseas expansion, a mature business or a business looking

general.headline: Former CEO of ANZ
general.description:
Mike Smith was the CEO of Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd (ANZ) from 2007 to 2015 following his retirement he remained an Adviser to the Board until July 2017.  He is the Chair of YBF Ventures (formerly York Butter Factory) and Chair of the YBF Fintech Advisory Board. YBF has been Australia’s centre of technological innovation since 2011 and is home to Melbourne’s first dedicated fintech hub and the world’s first Web 3.0 hub. He also holds the position of Senior Adviser Asia Practice at PwC.

Prior to this he was President and Chief Executive Officer, The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited; Chairman, Hang Seng Bank Limited; Global Head of Commercial Banking for the HSBC Group; and Chairman, HSBC Bank Malaysia Berhad.

He graduated with honours in Economic Sciences from City University London and in 2015 was awarded an Honorary Doctor of Science from City University London.  In 2013 he was awarded an Honorary Doctor of Laws from Monash University, Melbourne.

He is a Senior Fellow of the Financial Services Institute of Australasia and an immediate past Member of the Australian Bankers’ Association and Business Council of Australia.  He is a Member of the Chongqing Mayor’s International Economic Advisory Council, having previously served at its Executive Chairman, and a Fellow of The Hong Kong Management Association.  He was formerly a Director of the Institute of International Finance, the International Monetary Conference and Member of the Shanghai Mayor’s International Financial Advisory Council.  He is a Life Member of the Financial Markets Foundation for Children.

He was made an Officer of the Order of the British Empire in 2000 and a Chevalier de l’Ordre du Merite Agricole in 2007.

He is married with three children.  His interests include wine, tennis and classic cars.

general.headline:
CEO & Founder, Grace Papers. 
Award-winning programs & services that drive gender equality.
general.description:
Prue Gilbert: Lawyer, human rights advocate and mother empowering working parents across Australia 

Marie Claire called her out as the “the anti-discrimination guru”.  Vogue named her a “Game Changer” and her business, Grace Papers, won the Australian Human Rights Business Award for addressing pregnancy related discrimination. 

A lawyer by profession, Prue Gilbert is part of a new breed - a generation of social entrepreneurs who are redefining how businesses drive social change.  Integrating her vast legal, leadership and diversity experience, she co-founded Grace Papers to challenge traditional stereotypes and provide a platform to empower both working parents and their employers. 

Since launching Grace Papers in 2014, Prue and her team have supported expectant mothers and fathers to overcome gender stereotypes as well as discrimination faced in their workplaces during pregnancy, parental leave and returning to work.

Grace Papers, is a unique digital platform that provides working parents with the strategies, language and framework to navigate pregnancy, parental leave and career and the challenges that come with being a working parent. 

Her work transcends simple tactical tools and brings an inspiring new lens to advocacy and activism both through the online platform and her corporate coaching work.  As she educates leaders, CEOs, government and ASX-Listed businesses as well as the broader community, Prue is changing a generation of workplaces and creating positive parental journeys. 

Prue is a Fellow of the Governance Institute of Australia, a qualified executive coach, and has studied under The Empowerment Institute NYC to deepen her capacity to drive social change.

Prue volunteers for the legal steering committee of NOW Australia and has been an influencer in driving gender equality through her role as Advisory Board Member for the AFL Players Association for the Women’s League.

general.headline: Executive Leader, Lawyer & Advocate | Change Agent | Not-for-Profit, Legal & Public Sector | MAICD | BA(Hons)/LLB(Hons)
general.description:
Combining a passion for the law with strong social purpose, I’m dedicated to serving the public interest and improving the performance of our public sector and not-for-profit organisations – in order to drive better community outcomes. 

I have worked as a lawyer, advocate and leader in the criminal justice system and wider public sector. My progression to executive leadership comes from my key strength, courage. I am a change leader, ‘breaking’ traditional systems for the better in order to introduce models that are more effective and efficient. The primary purpose of my work has been to develop policies and structures that improve public services to people in our community by humanising the law and making justice more accessible. I create environments that inspire, positively challenge and motivate system collaboration. I amicably drive change setting standards of excellence that evolve services, team and organisational capabilities in often resource-strained, highly complex and emotionally driven public domains.

I have specialist knowledge across the prosecution and legal assistance sector in sexual offences, youth crime, family violence and sentencing. I have worked with many vulnerable clients and victims of crime and am an award-winning thought leader, influential media commentator and trusted policy reformist. I have been appointed by successive Victorian Governments to sit independently as a Commissioner of the Victorian Law Reform Commission; Director of the Sentencing Advisory Council; and most recently as a member of the Government's Family Violence Expert Advisory Committee into Perpetrator Accountability.

Most recently, I have provided strategic leadership to Victoria Legal Aid (VLA) and as Executive Director of Criminal Law Services positioned its largest division for an innovative and sustainable future.

I am currently exploring new challenges within the Government or NFP sector and welcome new connections. Contact me through LinkedIn or by email.

jobs.description:
Leading strategic reform across VLA’s largest division, my key aim was to improve the quality and efficiency of legal aid services for disadvantaged individuals eligible for aid. Leading 200 professionals across Indictable, Summary Crime, Youth Crime, Appeals & Strategic Litigation programs, I established service models, training and inter-agency collaboration standards and frameworks that have positioned the division to meet evolving challenges. In addition, I provided thought leadership across the criminal justice system, acted as VLA media spokesperson and continued to act on behalf of clients in complex criminal cases including representing VLA in Victoria’s first ever guideline judgment in the Court of Appeal - Boulton v R (2014) 46 VR 308 regarding community corrections orders.

•	Led a number of critical multi-year projects including the Summary Crime Evaluation highlighting congestion in the Magistrates’ Court, forming the foundation for significant system review and re-design alongside State Government investment

•	Re-established the Goulburn Valley office as a premium regional presence with new premises, improving VLA’s role in the local community while managing significant cultural change and re-profiling the office as a provider of more holistic legal services that increase access to justice  

•	Led a review of VLA’s Higher Court Appeals processes including ground-breaking work engaging with victims of crime from within a legal aid commission, in the glare of considerable political and media scrutiny and public disquiet about some of VLA’s appeal funding decisions

•	Delivered the High Quality Criminal Trials Project, improving trial services in response to judicial & government concerns around the quality of publicly funded criminal trials.  Key initiatives included a Preferred Criminal Barrister List and Major Criminal Cases Framework resulting in system quality & accountability uplifts; leading the Victorian Bar to establish an accreditation scheme.

general.headline: Associate Director Family Violence Response at Victoria Legal Aid
general.description:
Leanne is the Associate Director Family Violence Response at Victoria Legal Aid (VLA) and is responsible for leading VLA's whole of organisation efforts to implement reform and innovation in family violence service delivery for the benefit of clients affected by family violence and of the community as a whole.  Leanne is leading VLA's provides advice in relation to strategy, policy, legal issues and priorities relating to the provision of legal services as well as designing and implementing projects to improve services. 

Previously, as Program Manager Family Violence at VLA, Leanne was responsible for managing VLA’s family violence services, coordinating and advising on law reform directions and strategic advocacy priorities as well as managing family violence projects throughout the state. 

Leanne contributes to and sits on state wide law reform committees and stakeholder reference groups with the Department of Justice. 

Leanne undertakes legal file work, provides family violence and family law duty lawyer services and acts as an Independent Children's Lawyer in commonwealth parenting disputes, representing the best interests of children.

Leanne has a strong background in family law and family violence gained in government, the community sector and private practice. She was the Principal Lawyer at Women’s Legal Service Victoria (WLSV), a state-wide Community Legal Centre that specialises in legal matters arising from relationship breakdown and violence against women for five years and worked in a busy private family law practice for three years. 

In July 2017, Leanne was appointed to the board of No to Violence, Men's Referral Service.   Previously, she was a past chair and board member of the Women’s Domestic Violence Crisis Service (WDVCS), a state wide service that coordinates a crisis response to victims of family violence.

general.headline: Director, Global Economic Law Network
general.description:
Andrew is Professor at Melbourne Law School, Australian Research Council Future Fellow, Director of the Global Economic Law Network, a member of the Indicative List of Panelists to hear WTO disputes, and a member of the Energy Charter Roster of Panelists. He has previously practised law with Allens Arthur Robinson (now Allens Linklaters) and consults for States, international organisations and the private sector. Andrew has taught law in Australia, Canada and the US and is the recipient of four major current grants from the Australian Research Council and the Australian National Preventive Health Agency. He has published approximately 130 academic books and journal articles and is a Series Editor of the Oxford University Press International Economic Law Series, an Editorial Board Member of the Journal of International Economic Law and a General Editor on the Journal of International Dispute Settlement. He has law degrees from Melbourne, Harvard and Cambridge and is a Barrister and Solicitor of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

general.headline:
Barrister; Mediator (3 Wentworth Chambers);
Professor of Law at University of Sydney
general.description:
Elisabeth has a deep knowledge of legal principles in commercial and contract law and wide experience in their application to negotiating and litigating. She provides advice and legal representation as a barrister; services as a nationally accredited mediator; legal training services as an effective and experienced speaker and legal teacher.

Elisabeth was admitted in 1994 (BA (1st Hons); LLB (1st Hons, Medal) USyd) and completed her PhD on contractual implied terms at Cambridge University. Until 2007 she was as an academic (see website for publications), academic barrister and international law firm consultant. From 2007 Elisabeth has been a barrister fulltime, while remaining a Professor at Sydney University, teaching internationally. She is an editor of NSWLR and CLQ, a nationally accredited mediator and a frequent expert witness on Australian contract law in overseas jurisdictions. She appears in all courts and tribunals, mediations and arbitrations, for individuals, corporations and government bodies. Practice areas include appellate, commercial/contract, equity, strata, succession, medical/professional negligence.

jobs.description:
Elisabeth completed the LEADR mediation qualification and is nationally accredited.
      She provides parties with optimal opportunities for reaching settlement of disputes,
      
      without resort to litigation.

Elisabeth commenced as a lecturer at Sydney Law School in 1999 and was quickly promoted up to Professor in 2008. She teaches in LLB and JD subjects including Contract Law, Civil Procedure, Evidence, Interpretation. She teaches LLM courses including Breach of Contract, Controlling Liabiliy by Contract, Contractual Damages and Advanced Obligations.

Elisabeth worked as Prodean (Teaching) from January- December 2007, co-ordinating
      the 1600 student cohort and the permanent and casual teaching staff, including sitting
      on university and external committees. In 2008 the role of prodean also covered all
      
      aspects of staffing, and acting dean roles.

Elisabeth has a general practice with particular specialty in commercial and contract law. She appears in all courts and tribunals, including NSW Court of Appeal and High Court. She has acted for individuals, small companies, large companies and governments, providing efficient and effective advice and legal representation in litigation. She first practised as an academic barrister from 1999 and is now a fulltime barrister.

general.headline: Adjunct Professor at Macquarie University & Director at The National Justice Project
general.description:
George Newhouse is an Adjunct Professor of Law at Macquarie University and the Principal Solicitor of the National Justice Project a not-for profit law firm committed to upholding human rights in Australia and the Pacific.

He has also been involved in some of Australia's most well known Civil and Human Rights Cases. He authors the Civil Justice Issues chapter in the Laws of Australia. He was formerly Mayor of Waverley Council with extensive experience in local government, planning and environmental law and a mediator to the Local Court of NSW, and a member of the Workers Compensation Commission and the Consumer Trader and Tenancy Tribunal.

In 2004 Newhouse was appointed to the NSW Architects Registration Board to represent the views of local government.

In 2008, following the Australia 2020 summit, Newhouse together with Warren Mundine established the Australian Indigenous Chamber of Commerce to promote indigenous entrepreneurship. 

Newhouse is a member of the Board of the Stolen Generations Testimony Foundation and of the Advisory Board of the Buzo Theatre Company.

In August 2009 Newhouse travelled to PNG to establish the Adrian Lam Foundation to assist youth in PNG through education and sport.

In 2011 Newhouse was a board member of of the Australian Women  Chamber of Commerce.

general.school: Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand
general.description:
I have over 25 years of experience in senior finance roles in large blue chip industrial companies, with expertise in leading group strategy and finance in the Energy and Utilities sector. Prior to joining AGL in 2007, I held numerous finance roles at BOC in the South Pacific and North America, Email and CSR, which complemented my background in chartered accounting at Deloitte.
 
I was appointed AGL’s CFO in 2012 and am responsible for driving AGL’s key priority - to execute growth at scale as the business seeks new revenue streams. This builds on leading previous successful growth initiatives including the acquisitions of Loy Yang A and Macquarie power stations, as well as recently creating the Powering Australian Renewables Fund.

jobs.description: AGL is committed to helping shape a sustainable energy future for Australia. We operate the country’s largest electricity generation portfolio, we’re its largest ASX-listed investor in renewable energy, and we have more than 3.6 million customer accounts. Proudly Australian, with more than 180 years of experience, we have a responsibility to provide sustainable, secure and affordable energy for our customers. Our aim is to prosper in a carbon-constrained world and build customer advocacy as our industry transforms. That’s why we have committed to exiting our coal-fired generation by 2050 and why we will continue to develop innovative solutions for our customers.

Working at a senior level, advises CEO’s and executives on media, messaging, brand and corporate positioning, stakeholder engagement and community relations. Employing a positive, collaborative and practical approach, has a reputation for building and leading teams through periods of significant change, transition and growth to deliver tangible business outcomes.

jobs.companyName: APPA Australian Pharmaceutical medical and scientific Professionals Association
jobs.description:
The Australian Pharmaceutical medical and scientific Professionals Association is the representative association for Medical Affairs in Australia and is dedicated to promoting excellence in pharmaceutical medicine through professional development, networking and advocacy

APPA is an association of medical directors, medical advisors and medical scientific liaisons working within medical affairs departments of Australian pharmaceutical companies.

Members work within the pharmaceutical industry to help bring innovative medicines to Australian patients by supporting the development, licensing, monitoring and marketing of these medicines. They also build relationships with the medical community to promote the pharmaceutical industry. 

APPA meets fours times a year to discuss issues facing the industry as well as to network. Its annual general meeting is held annually in December when the Executive Committee is elected to administer the affairs of the association.

APPA is aligned with ARCS Australia and Medicines Australia. It is a member association of the International Federation of Associations of Pharmaceutical Physicians (IFAPP). APPA supports the Graduate Diploma in Pharmaceutical Medicine qualification of the University of New South Wales.

Appointed to advise PSA on improvements to PSA'S practice support and education offer and role in advanced practice that will benefit pharmacists working in the career pathway.

general.headline: Senior Manager Logistics and Operational Excellence, ANZ
general.description:
Innovative Supply Chain leader | Drives operational excellence | Introduces a customer-centric approach | Builds continuous improvement cultures | Change and transformation leader | Strategic Business partner

An experienced, versatile business manager, my strength is operational leadership – specifically, establishing and leading effective teams, building strong organisational cultures that drive continuous improvement and deliver operational excellence. I offer ten years’ experience in the Healthcare sector and ten years in Financial services.
 
I work collaboratively across organisations to lead transformation and change initiatives that drive productivity and operational improvements to support business growth . I understand that strong, effective teams are the foundation for commercial success, so I am also passionate about fostering a high performance culture where everyone from the production floor and distribution partners through to the senior executive team – are focused on delivering business objectives
 
Working at a local, regional and global level, I have established a strong track record for managing change transformation particularly through Supply Chain operations and championing IBP throughout the organisation. I achieve this by implementing well defined strategies that drive innovation and a strong focus on the customer experience thus enabling  alignment and execution of commercial goals. This customer-centric approach is considerably underutilised in supply chain management, and can have a strong impact on profitability – by increasing customer satisfaction, driving sales and enhancing reputation.

The E2E supply chain is a complex mechanism of many moving parts which provides opportunities to deliver improved costs and service to customers as well as identify and drive new commercial strategies. Throughout my career I have established a reputation for challenging the status quo to identify improvement opportunities and then executing to plan.

general.headline: Site Quality Director at Pfizer
general.description:
Jeney Isbel, Site Quality Director at Pfizer PGS Melbourne facility (located in Mulgrave), has over 20 years’ of experience as a qualified Chemical Engineer within the Global Pharmaceutical Industry.  She completed her degree at The Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT University, Melbourne, Australia).

Jeney began her career as an Engineer in the Paper & Printing Industry, then moved into the pharmaceutical industry as a Logistics/Project Engineer at an active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) manufacturer; Institute of Drug Technology (IDT), Australia. She joined the Melbourne site as DBL/Faulding in 1999 and has held various roles over the last 17 years in Quality & Supply (New Product Launch) such as Manager of Change Control & Documentation, Interim R&D Project Manager, Operational Quality & Batch Release Manager (MQ) and Compliance Manager until May 2014 at which time she was appointed the Site Quality Director (SQOL) for the site. Her expertise includes equipment validation, process engineering, printing/packaging, with specialties in Compliance Remediation, Batch Release, Quality Systems, Manufacturing Quality, Deviation Management and Regulatory inspection management within the sterile aseptic manufacturing environment. Jeney has a wealth of knowledge to support the immense challenges and ultimately the satisfaction of leading all site-wide Quality Operations (QA & QC) with her experience in APIs and Aseptic manufacture of oncolytic and high potent molecules for all major global markets.

jobs.description: Reporting to the VP Quality Operations, Sterile Injectables, this role requires the maintenance and development of Quality Systems for the Mulgrave site (aligned to Global Quality Policies). The role is a Senior Leadership position which is responsible for the leadership, development and performance of the Quality Unit including development and maintenance of site wide quality policies, ensuring maintenance of GMP licensing requirements, assuring Company practices meet TGA, FDA, MHRA, EMA, Health Canada, cGMP and other regulations, ensuring all products and processes are of the specified quality and comply with the requirements of customers (internal and external). The role includes responsible person of release for sale ensuring product compliance to marketing authorisation.

The Board of Enjoy Church is primarily responsible for the compliance, assurance and risk management of the church. It is their responsibility to ensure that the church as a legal entity is in compliance with its obligations and responsibilities, whilst remaining committed to the practice of risk management with strategic decision making and operation oversight.

Reporting to the Site Quality Director, this role requires the management of a team to ensure regulatory compliance of the Mulgrave site. The role is responsible for External Audits (Regulatory/Customer), Internal Audits, Annual Product Reviews, Recall Management, Training, Change Control & Documentation, QA investigations, Validation Support and Quality support/interaction (cGMP).

      ensure all batches are audited and appropriately dispositioned/released from the
      Mulgrave site. The role is responsible for Batch Release, Batch Auditing, QA
      
      investigations and Quality support/interaction with all production areas (m

      systems in line with current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and company
      
      policies.

Resulting from an independent consultant audit the site developed an action plan to introduce compliant and best practice standards across a number of systems. In order to action the resultant plan a number of project leaders were seconded from within the business. The project leaders were required to determine best practices across specific systems and implement these changes according to an agreed project schedule.

New Product Launch Coordinators work to ensure manufacturing slots are made

Various activities were performed in the role of Quality Assurance Associate - 1)

Over the 2 years at IDT I reported to both the Logistics Manager and the Engineering Projects Manager. The company was small and growing quickly and required the utilization of skills to assist the business in many areas, however my skills were primarily required in setting up the facility and related systems for the manufacture of Active Pharmaceuticals Ingredients (APIs).

general.headline: Managing Director at Incenta Economic Consulting

jobs.description:
Jeff is the Managing Director of Incenta. Jeff has 20 years of experience in relation to economic regulation issues across the electricity, gas and airports sectors in Australia and New Zealand and experience in relation to water, post and telecommunications. He has advised governments, regulators and major corporations on issues including the development of regulatory frameworks, regulatory price reviews, licensing and franchise bidding and market design. Jeff has also undertaken a number of expert witness assignments. His particular specialities have been on the application of finance principles to economic regulation, the design of tariff structures, the design of incentive compatible regulation and the drafting and economic interpretation of regulatory instruments.

In addition, Jeff has led a number of analytical assignments for firms to understand the responsiveness of consumers to changes to prices or other factors (like promotional activities) to use in informing pricing strategy.

Jeff previously was a Principal at PwC in its economics and policy team for almost 4 years, prior to that a director and partner at the Allen Consulting Group for over 13 years, and prior that he held a number of policy positions in the Commonwealth Government. In this latter role, he was on the secretariat of the Gas Reform Task Force (1995-1996), where he played a lead role in the development of the National Gas Code.

Before coming to AHPRA, I was at the Victorian Bar, where I acted in administrative law matters. Before coming to the Bar, I was in the Office of General Counsel at the Australian Government Solicitor. In that role I served as Client Counsel to the Commonwealth Treasury. I have extensive experience advising on the development and interpretation of legislation regulating areas ranging from insurance to aged care. I have a strong interest in privacy and information management in a digital environment.  I have acted for the Commonwealth in debt recovery and trade practices litigation.

In 2003 I completed a Bachelor of Civil Law degree at the University of Oxford, with a particular interest in evidence and restitution.

general.headline: Human Resource Manager
general.description:
Highly experienced People and Culture professional with a passion for transformational communication and the development and implementation of strategies and solutions designed to improve performance and organisational culture.  Outstanding interpersonal and relationship building skills, and the ability to positively influence at all levels underpins outstanding results in areas including: 

•	Strategic business partnering
•	Development and implementation of OD and cultural improvement initiatives
•	HR team capability and service quality
•	Workplace change / reform
•	Employee and industrial relations
•	Leadership development
•	People Management confidence, competence and capabilities

Key to success has been the ability to always challenge cultural norms and the status quo; raise expectations around leadership, performance, ownership and accountability, embracing the notion that there are no “sacred cows”, and having a strong focus on the needs of the business by working with and through it’ people.

Highly experienced in all facets of strategic and operational human resource management; workplace/organisational/structural change; employee an industrial relations; workplace investigations; recruitment; succession planning; performance planning, development and management; industrial instruments and legislation; training, leadership and team development; WHS; workers compensation claims management; position review & evaluation, and wages and salary administration.   

Experience gained in Manufacturing; Logistics; Heavy transport / Freight Rail; Equipment Hire and Local Government industries.

jobs.jobTitle: Service Manager HR Delivery (Head of HR Delivery)
jobs.description:
This position is responsible for leading and managing the HR Delivery, Recruitment and Administration functions of the HR Team. This includes continuous improvement of the delivery of a range of HR strategies, frameworks, policies, procedures and services so that managers are equipped to support, manage and develop their employees. 
•	Lead the HR Delivery team to focus on establishing and delivering a high quality HR service, collaborate with each other, and grow their capability as strategic partners in order to provide strategic HR value to Council’s business.	
•	Coach and mentor team members to provide a high performance team culture which drives business efficiencies.			
•	Establish and implement business strategies with a longer term basis based on the organizations vision. This includes driving the review/audit, implementation, education and embedding of HR service improvements and innovations so managers and employees adopt them as part of their normal workplace practices.
•	In conjunction with the Head of HR, devise and develop Council’s workforce planning strategy and associated programs including recruitment and succession planning activities.
•	Influence and coach the business in contemporary change management practices during improvement and reform initiatives to support the business in successfully embedding new work arrangements.
•	Drive and deliver business improvement functions within the broader HR team creating a seamless HR service delivery. Lead in procedures and practices that address workforce diversity issues to support the organization in meeting its strategic priorities for attracting and retaining talent.

•	Track progress and report to Project Sponsor and PSG. 
•	Identify, manage and mitigate project risk and ensure appropriate contingencies are in place. 
•	Manage, escalate and resolve project issues. 
•	Coordinate post implementation reviews and ensure it is documented. 
•	External vendor management.

•	Lead the Business Support function within the HR division.
•	Proactively consult, influence and negotiate management in line with MTN Group governance processes, OpCo Strategy and Local (Cyprus) & EU Legislative requirements.

general.headline: Senior Tech Recruiter at Zendesk | Organiser of Melbourne Recruitment Meetup #melbrecmeetup
general.description:
Hi, I'm Matt.

I'm an experienced recruiter with a background in agency and, more recently, in-house talent functions. 

I have a real passion for process improvement, using new technology to enhance an organisation's ability to attract, secure and retain the very best talent in Australia. My focus on this over the past few years, with Xero and MYOB, has enable me to add value while also gaining a huge amount of personal and professional development in the process!

My passion for all things recruitment has led me to establish the Melbourne Recruitment Meetup - http://www.meetup.com/melbrecmeetup/ It's aimed at creating a more collaborative, supportive recruitment industry in the city. With over 850 members to date, it's proving a very popular platform for learning, development and networking.

Moving forward my interest continues to lie within the recruitment sector. Whether this is as part of an internal function focused on developing capability or as an independent consultant, I'm open to what  ever new challenges come my way!

jobs.description:
Managed, supported and developed a team of 2 Senior Talent Acquisition Specialists. 

Overall responsibility for agreeing and executing on talent acquisition strategies across MYOB - a complex business that recruits/backfills over 300 FTE per year across Australia and New Zealand. 

Maintained a very hands-on approach and recruited all mid to senior roles (often junior roles too!) across all areas of the business.

Project managed the recruitment of over 85 contract FTE (2-3 months) for the end of financial year contact centre peak. This was over an 8 week period. It was the largest, and ultimately, most successful project of its type undertaken to date and led to a nomination in MYOB’s end of year company awards as a result.

Designed a new and innovative strategy focussing on the end-to-end candidate experience. This was a real departure from the purely process focused approach hiring managers had been taking up to this point. It aligned to both company values as well as MYOB’s new brand strategy. 

Trialled a range of innovative new technologies which added considerable value to MYOB’s recruitment process - Textio, Crystal Knows, Grammarly, Reffind. Some of these are scheduled for implementation in Q1/Q2 next year.

Responsible for all recruitment activity across the Risk, Finance and Service Experience (Operations) teams.

Drove an increased awareness and usage of differing social media channels across the People Experience functions. The aim being to increase awareness of the bank’s new strategic direction but also to attract more dynamic and innovative skill sets to the organisation.

Created and spearheaded initiatives to bring greater structure and rigour to existing recruitment processes.

At Xero I was responsible for all non-technical recruitment for Xero: Design, Sales, Enablement, Education, Facilities, Finance, Legal, Strategy and for the WorkflowMax add-on partner. This was the most diverse portfolio at Xero and required a variety of differing approaches to suit both the hiring managers and types of candidates sought. The teams I worked with were based in Auckland, Wellington and Melbourne.

In June 2012, I was made permanent in a hybrid position incorporating both talent (HR)
      and talent sourcing for the Assurance line of service – a business unit with around 100
      staff. After June 2013 I was also responsible for the recruitment of staff into PwC’s
      
      South Island offices.

12-month maternity leave contract covering recruitment across all lines of service for
      
      the 250+ staff in the Wellington office.

Operated with a huge focus on recruiting candidates for senior financial services roles - covering the Accounting, Tax, Insurance and Superannuation sectors.
Having re-established and further enhanced the OCG's accounting and insurance presence in Wellington, I assumed the key account management responsibility for OCG's financial services clients - covering the banking, superannuation and wider insurance sectors.

I was responsible for initiating and developing the Accounting and Financial Services
      desk in the Wellington office. Sourced new clients, effectively developed and
      maintained relationships and grew business opportunities organically. This was in both
      
      the private and government sectors.

Having successfully improved both staff performance and the business relations with the client at Orange Business, I was asked to manage the initial start up of the new insourced project RESPONSE had secured with one of the largest UK banks, Abbey.

I recruited a team of 10 Inbound Customer Service Advisors to begin this 6 month trial period. 
Due to the success of the project, we secured a rolling 2 year contract which also required a staff expansion from 10 to 120 over a period of 4 months.

general.headline: National HR Manager IKEA  | Talent Cultivator | Leadership Developer | Learning Facilitator & Coach | Experienced MC
general.description:
I lead by example to positively influence and steer my key partners across the organisation towards sustainable growth. I lead with passion for people and knowledge of contemporary and best practice organisational development frameworks. I pride myself on successfully designing and implementing strategic talent management initiatives with having both qualitative and quantitative results in my backpack.
With each role I have held I have aimed to provide superior service to the customer, to all staff members and potential staff members. Acting as a brand ambassador in conjunction with my specialised position, I firstly think like a consumer and through my role as HR Manager I am driven to ensure we have high performing co-workers exceeding our customers’ expectations. I lead a business through its people and I enjoy taking on the role of a leader, a coach and a mentor and this allows me to share my values which are focused on teamwork, accountability and excellence. 
As an experienced HR Executive I provide the knowledge of ER and IR Strategies that promote a strong employer positioning for internal and external talent to consider the organisation as a long term venture. I have a well-developed toolkit to effectively support my business partners navigate the sometimes - complicated world that is a workplace to ensure we are all working towards common goals as leaders and managers.
I am personally working to master the art of leadership and the link between business strategy and people management. I am a leader who thinks outside the box and dares to be different daily. You will find me always thinking with the destination or wished position in mind to set a vision and a goal of what we are trying to achieve collaboratively. I consider myself approachable and a team player, this allows me to sit in a role to advise staff, relate to staff and motivate staff to be the best versions of themselves in pursuit of their aspirations.

jobs.jobTitle: National HR Manager  - Talent, Leadership and Competence.
jobs.description:
Acting as National Talent Manager , I lead the talent and leadership agenda for  IKEA Australia,  delivering ambitious succession, talent and leadership goals. Through proactively engaging the key people leaders, with inspiring communication and working through collaboration to provide our rapidly growing business with a continuous pipeline of internal and external talent.

 This role requires me to be an innovative thinker and utilise my strong expertise in Talent Management across recruitment, succession planning, leadership development, competence development, and performance management.

Role scope : 
 - Lead the development and implementation of Talent related approaches / frameworks, tools and ways of working in connection to the IKEA Talent, including Employer Branding, Recruitment & On-Boarding, Succession Development, Performance Management, Competence Development and Leadership Development
 - Lead the Talent Review processes, coach and support Functional Managers, Store Managers and Unit HR Managers
 - Lead the development, management and facilitation of Fast Tracker programs
 - Track and follow up all high potentials for Executive Group Management (build relationships and be part of defining their next step)
 - Design and development of Leadership Approach for IKEA Australia and manage Leadership, Management, Coaching and Mentoring Development Programs

Acting as a steering partner to the business securing outstanding business performance through highly motivated IKEA People.

In my current role I am  leader who cultivates talent in others and leads with passion and purpose.
I look to empower those I work with and be an example to follow. I let people know they matter and ensure they have the tools to succeed. As I continue on my journey in mastering the art of leadership – I wish to display visionary qualities and build meaningful relationships across the organization. 
Within my role my success comes down to what and how I inspire others to succeed. I endeavor to set certainty and earn trust through my actions and my words. To sell a vision to our people, one direction and objective to succeed as one team. I see myself as an image maker by leading by example and through clear and strong  communication.

I hope to stay authentic and always exhibit flexibility in my approach, have ethical behavior, be professional and well organized as I expand my knowledge within HR and in Operations with IKEA.

The companies span luxury property, HR & Resourcing Service, and marketing, PR, and events. Within this established and renowned group, I work predominantly for Black Diamondz HR Concierge. From here the group has grown to incorporate Black Diamondz PR & Marketing and Black Diamondz HR Concierge.

general.headline: Chief Marketing Officer @ Weploy | Changing the way we work
general.description:
Thanks for stopping by, here's a quick overview of what I’ve been up to...

I’ve recently joined Weploy, an exciting start up in the HR technology space, as Chief Marketing Officer with my primary focus on driving sustainable and profitable growth across the APAC region.

Previously I led the marketing team for the LinkedIn Sales Solutions and Marketing Solutions lines of business. Working hand in hand with sales to deliver on always impressive targets we consistently saw success and I’m forever grateful to have worked alongside some incredible talent.

Before that, I spent the past decade managing successful marketing and sales teams in Europe and Australia, building two new business lines from the ground up in separate companies.

On a more personal note, I love data and don’t understand how anyone can create a strategy without a spreadsheet. I’m a big believer in value based leadership and that belonging is a crucial element to any teams success.

Having started my career in content strategy I still enjoy getting my hands dirty writing whitepapers and ebooks. Worked in both start up environments as well as large complex matrix organisations I’ve really been able to hone my stakeholder management skills (the most important skill for any business leader nowadays). And I’m confident in my ability to drive action and help businesses prioritise on what’s most important at that moment. 

I’m always open to ideas on partnerships and the best marketing talent so if you’re interested in working with me in either capacity please drop me an InMail.

jobs.jobTitle: Talent Resourcing and Employer Brand Specialist at THE ICONIC
jobs.description:
THE ICONIC is a truly unique brand. We entered the market in 2011 with the vision of defining the future of fashion retail. 

THE ICONIC stands for benchmark-setting experiences (3HR delivery, access to over 700 top brands, market-leading shopping app), for impassioned communities (connecting Australians fashion and sports lovers through digital innovation), and for our love of the newest in fashion from our 700+ leading local and international brands. We want to inspire Australians and New Zealanders to constantly explore new sides of their identity, and have a whole lot of fun doing it.

THE ICONIC exists to empower our customers. For us, fashion and sport are transformative means by which everyone can express their true self. We enable this by creating seamless customer experiences, boundless technical innovations, unrivaled product ranges and personalised inspiration.

WE ARE NOT A RETAILER.

WE ARE A LIBERATOR.

At THE ICONIC we live and breathe our values every day. They are the core principles that guide us, connect us and strengthen the relationships we have with our amazing customers, partners and brands. The values we live by also demonstrate the passion and care we have for both the employee and customer experience.

general.headline: Head of HR - ANZ
general.description:
ABOUT ME

A senior HR professional with skills and experience in a wide range of HR activities including: employee relations, performance management, negotiation, recruitment, training, projects and remunerations and benefits. 

I approach both strategic and operational HR by understanding the business agenda, and providing strategic and operationaly relevent advice. I aim to empower and support the management and immediate team I work with to make appropriate decisions for the business.

ABOUT SWAROVSKI

Swarovski delivers a diverse portfolio of unmatched quality, craftsmanship, and creativity.
Founded in 1895 in Austria, Swarovski designs, manufactures and markets high-quality crystals, genuine gemstones and created stones as well as finished products such as jewelry, accessories and lighting. Now celebrating its 120th anniversary and run by the fifth generation of family members, Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,560 stores in around 170 countries, more than 25,000 employees, and revenue of about 2.33 billion euros in 2014. 

Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. In 2014, the Group generated revenue of about 3.05 billion euros and employed more than 30,000 people. The Swarovski Foundation was set up in 2012 to honor the philanthropic spirit of founder Daniel Swarovski. Its mission is to support creativity and culture, promote wellbeing, and conserve natural resources. 

Whether you’re interested in gaining valuable experience as an intern or apprentice, or challenging yourself as an accomplished professional, Swarovski offers flexible, exciting and rewarding career opportunities in many different areas.

general.headline: Chief Procurement Officer
general.description: An experienced Chief Procurement Officer and leader of complex business transformations with a demonstrated record of delivering bottom line value to complex Blue Chip business’ through transforming Procurement functions into trusted and respected commercial business partners.  An innovative and pragmatic leader drawing on more than 20 years experience in global corporate and consulting roles in Procurement, organisation wide cost reduction, Shared Services and Human Resources, passionate about leading high performing teams, most recently in the transformation and return to profitability of Qantas.

jobs.description:
Proxima Procurement consulting is a leading provider of procurement Consulting,
      Managed Services, On-Demand Services and Commercial Management Services
      focussed on helping our clients around the globe take control of their complex network
      of external assets, changing the conventional view of procurement from an
      administrative function to one of a strategic driver of value.

Reporting to the Qantas Group CFO led the Transformation of Procurement at Qantas to become a trusted and respected commercial business partner delivering significant commercial and operating outcomes through Australia’s largest corporate turnaround.
 
•Turned around the Procurement function, establishing a trusted and respected commercial business partner delivering significant commercial and operating outcomes in Australia’s largest corporate turnaround 
•Significantly reduced bottom line supplier costs with significant additional Total Cost of Ownership cost reductions driving delivery of $2 billion Qantas Cost Transformation 
•Improved global supplier performance and innovation increasing business service delivery, competitiveness and profitability across 23 global locations and 7000 flights per week
•Delivered consistent global Fuel Supply Chain quality, safety and service 
•Significantly improved Supply Chain performance with reductions in inventory, increase in stock turns and elimination of stock outs
•Led Qantas’ largest corporate Transformation and IT project in 2015 creating visibility and control of $3 billion supplier expenditure and lower cost of transaction through successful implementation of Oracle Purchase to Pay
•Established global offshore Procurement Shared Service to support all Procurement transactions  
•Significantly uplifted procurement team capability through targeted development of team skills and capabilities 
•Reduced risk of damage to Brand and Service from supply chain e.g. child labour, by implementing risk assessment and governance

The Litmus Group, now the Consulting division of leading  Advisory firm PPB is an employee owned boutique consulting firm (turnover approx $20 million pa) formed by senior leaders from leading global consulting firms to focus on enabling leading organisations to turn strategy into action and sustainable improvements in business performance. The firm’s ownership by all employees and innovative ways of working created a unique high performing consulting culture which has been widely recognized including being named in BRW’s Great Places to Work in 2010. 

As Senior Partner building a new capability in Procurement Transformation, rapidly established Litmus reputation for delivering sustained Procurement improvement and benefits delivery to a Blue Chip client base including Rio Tinto, Newcrest Mining and Qantas through an innovative multi disciplinary approach to Procurement Transformation and Cost Reduction.

As leader of the Business and Procurement Consulting teams responsible for leadership of the Business Consulting team of 50 and working with client Executive Committees and Senior Leaders to deliver significant bottom line benefits through National and Global Procurement and Supply Chain Transformation Programs in leading private and public sector organisations across all sectors..

Early career comprised Australian, Asia Pacific and global roles in Rio Tinto Business Units spanning Group Procurement, Organisational Effectiveness, Human Resources and Public Affairs across Argyle Diamonds, Iron Ore, Aluminium,  Headquarters (Melbourne and London) and the US  including a key role in the establishment of global Group Procurement.

My various roles at cochlear have encompassed end-to-end procurement processes, from foundational operational to executive level strategy. I have built and managed a high performing implantable team and more recently established a new strategic sourcing arm to better support development and seamless commercialisation of product.

jobs.description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Opal Specialist Aged Care is the leading Aged Care provider in Australia with approximately 5000 staff nationally. Opal has 60 facilities with 5200 residents in four states with Head Office in Sydney.  
 
ROLE OVERVIEW
My role as Head of Procurement is transformational in nature and a key imperative is developing and implementing sustainable procurement strategies and governance models that enables Opal to take advantage of its scale and expertise in its field. Procurement’s focus will be on aligning outcomes in line with the companies values of Respect, Compassion and Accountability and these values will underpin the Procurement strategy we develop and with positive outcomes for our residents at its core.
 
A small team of Procurement professionals report to me and together we manage in excess of $100m of spend across business critical direct and indirect spend categories; Medical, Mobility, Clinical, Kitchen, Laundry, Hospitality equipment and services as well as travel, energy, office products etc

jobs.companyName: Veolia Environment Australia and New Zealand
jobs.description:
Company Profile
In Australia and New Zealand, Veolia Environnement responds to its clients' needs with tailored and cost effective solutions in water, waste management, energy and transportation.

Veolia Environmental Services is one of Australia's largest providers of sustainable & innovative environmental solutions. Serving the needs of more than 50,000 industrial, commercial & municipal clients, we offer a complete range of resource recovery, recycling, waste management & industrial services. Veolia Environmental Services operates from more than 100 sites across Australia & employs over 3000 people.

Veolia Water creates innovative water solutions for municipal & industrial customers in Australia & New Zealand. We manage assets of the water cycle, including reuse & desalination solutions and design, build and operate advanced water & wastewater treatment plants & networks.

Veolia Energy (Dalkia) provides heating, ventilating & air conditioning solutions to over 5000 retail, commercial and industrial clients in Australia. We also provide comprehensive building management services for heating & cooling networks, energy and multi-technical services including cogeneration & biomass solutions.

Veolia Transport Australasia is one of the region's leading public transport providers. Over 56 million passenger journeys a year are made in Australia & New Zealand on our train, bus, light-rail and monorail operations. In partnership with local governments, public authorities & private companies, we deliver services in Sydney, Perth, the South-West region of Western Australia, Brisbane & Auckland. 

Role Profile
I am responsible for leading all direct and indirect sourcing activity and driving procurement improvement / compliance across all group companies. This includes but is not limited to, reviewing existing procurement strategies and procedures, driving procurement related change and risk mitigation through the business with a team of six direct reports.

Company Profile
With over 50 years industry experience and over 2000 staff globally, Aristocrat has built on its Australian market leadership and reputation to become a premium supplier of groundbreaking technologies and services to the international gaming industry. Aristocrat enjoys a well-earned reputation for outstanding performance and strong brand equity in more than 200 jurisdictions around the world. The diverse product line-up extends from electronic gaming machines to complete gaming solutions, including systems, services, electronic tables, and ancillary equipment. 
Aristocrat offices are located in Australia, the USA, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, South Africa, Sweden, Argentina, Japan, and Macau. 

Role Profile
Transformation role to elevate Procurement from a typical Supply Management Procurement function to a broader business partnering function that aligns more closely with the overall business objectives under the new Global Business Strategy and Vision. Encompassing enterprise wide global communications strategies to support the Strategic Sourcing vision the Manager, Strategic Sourcing – Indirects role is accountable for the development, management and maintenance of enterprise wide internal client relationships, global 3rd party supplier relationships, development, implementation and maintenance of category management strategies for the business’ Global indirect category spend of in excess of $100 million AUD .

Company Profile
Novartis provides healthcare solutions that address the evolving needs of patients and societies. Focused solely on healthcare, Novartis offers a diversified portfolio to best meet these needs: innovative medicines, cost-saving generic pharmaceuticals, preventive vaccines, diagnostic tools and consumer health products. Novartis is the only company with leading positions in these areas. In 2009, the Group's continuing operations achieved net sales of USD 44.3 billion, while approximately USD 7.5 billion was invested in R&D activities throughout the Group. Headquartered in Basel, Switzerland, Novartis Group companies employ approximately 100,000 full-time associates and operate in more than 140 countries around the world.

Role Profile
Start up role to implement indirect strategic procurement & sourcing functions across six business units in Australia and New Zealand. Develop and implement sourcing policies, drive change and manage compliance. Establish centralised purchasing and category management functions across the group managing four sourcing professionals which will influence in excess of $150 million AUD indirect spend in 2011.

Company Profile
Corporate Express Australia is the leading provider of goods and services to business in Australia with annual revenues in 2010 exceeding $1.5 billion $AUD

Lines of Business include - General Office Products, Stationery, I.T products, Liquor, Furniture, Printing, Canteen, Janitorial, Washroom, Safety, Packaging, Education and Library supplies. 

Role Profile
Multiple category management roles controlling several portfolios of strategic supply agreements and rebate programs. Drove vendor and inventory management programs. Facilitated the catalogue program and product selection process for the categories managed. Responsible for driving purchasing and merchandising direction through regular communication and presentations with key internal business managers, sales representatives and strategic suppliers.
